page.title: 06THE LAUGHTON COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Laughton is in the heart of Sussex and is surrounded by the South Downs. A typical view of the landscape would comprise open farmland, with perhaps some areas of woodland. In one of the fields there is a flock of rooks which can be seen every day. Magpies and jays are also very common. There are over a hundred different types of tree in Laughton, including oaks, spruce, ash, willow, pine and fruit trees such as apple, pear, cherry and damson. The number of rabbits has increased in recent years: they are now very common. Grey squirrels can be frequently seen. Foxes, hedgehogs and other small mammals inhabit the area. Grass snakes can be seen in the local fields.
